newsitem.title: HUNGARY: OTP ends lower after results in mixed mkt.
newsitem.headline: OTP ends lower after results in mixed mkt.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed mixed on Friday what traders attributed to the disappointment of investors following the release of January-September earnings reports by most companies.
The BUX index closed at 3,562.09 points, down 18.91.

November 15 was the deadline for companies in the listed A category of the Budapest Stock Exchange to submit their nine-month reports. Investors still wait for the results of Fotex and financial consultant Dunaholding.
"The market's optimism seems to decline," said Attila Hunyady of Buda-Cash Brokerhaz Kft. "This is well reflected by futures prices."
On Friday BUX index futures closed lower for five maturities by between 13.50 and 27.50 points, and remained steady for one maturity.
December BUX futures fell the most -- 27.50 points -- to 3,663.00 points.

"Despite the fact that nine-month results were generally good, expectations of very strong results were already built in prices," Hunyady said. "Therefore when figures were not very strong just good, prices began to decline."
Friday's batch of earnings reports included those of OTP Bank, Primagaz, Ibusz and Cofinec.
OTP dropped 35 forints to close at 2,690, Cofinec closed unchanged at 4,100 forints. Ibusz remained untraded, while Primagaz advanced 40 forints to finish at 6,500.
